ground_truth: He points to the chair on the other side of the coffee table. He closes his eyes tight. Cole, surprised, takes a small step forward. Cole takes a step. Malcolm opens his eyes. He looks right at Cole. Cole takes another step. The next step will put him at the chair. Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple. Malcolm smiles. Malcolm looks to Cole's arm. Cole is wearing a large silver watch. It swims on his thin wrist. Malcolm closes his eyes. Cole takes a step back. Malcolm lowers his hands surprised. Malcolm puts his fingers to his temple. He gazes at Cole's school uniform. Cole takes a slow step back. Cole answers by taking a small step back. Malcolm looks down at Cole's feet. Cole is very still. Malcolm takes his time before speaking. He just stares. Cole quietly takes a step back into the doorway of the other room. Cole's tiny figure steps away. Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian restaurant. He finds Anna. Anna sits alone at a corner table. A small piece of cake with a candle in it sits untouched. Anna stirs sugar in her coffee as Malcolm sits in the seat across from her. Anna quietly takes a sip from her coffee. She glances across the table, then looks down. Malcolm demonstrates by holding up his arm to shield his face. Malcolm stops walking. The words hit him hard. He stares at Cole. Cole is surprised. Cole is playing behind the couch. All we see is the top of his head. Every now and then we get glimpses of things Cole is playing with peeking over the back of the couch, but we can't quite make out what he's doing. The top of Cole's head stops moving. Cole has become very still. He looks right at Malcolm. Malcolm watches him carefully. He rises and grabs his coat. Cole's brow furrows as he thinks about it carefully. Malcolm turns back to Cole. Cole's sad eyes stare up at Malcolm. The surface of Malcolm's desk is covered with open texts. Malcolm pours over a thick reference book. He circles a phrase. His face turns up to the ceiling. Malcolm gets up and moves closer to their voices as he stretches his legs. Malcolm smiles at Anna. Malcolm slowly stops smiling. Malcolm shakes his head in disbelief. Mr. Cunningham turns and stares at his class of eight and nine year old private school students. Cole rests his chin on his desk and watches the class with big eyes. Stanley Cunningham looks over the class of blank faces. He's just about to answer his own question when he sees a hand go up. Mr. Cunningham looks surprised to see who it is.

Malcolm opens his eyes. He glances directly at Cole. Cole makes another step. The subsequent stride will place him at the chair. Malcolm lowers his digits from his temple. Malcolm grins. Malcolm glances to Cole's limb. Cole is wearing a large silver timepiece. It swims on his slender wrist. Malcolm shuts his eyes. Cole makes a step backward. Malcolm lowers his hands astonished. Malcolm puts his digits to his temple. He gazes at Cole's school attire. Cole makes a slow step backward. Cole responds by making a small step backward. Malcolm glances downward at Cole's feet. Cole is very still. Malcolm takes his time prior to speaking. He just gazes. Cole quietly makes a step backward into the doorway of the opposite room. Cole's tiny form steps away. Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian bistro. He locates Anna. Anna sits solitary at a corner table. A small slice of cake with a candle in it sits untouched. Anna stirs sugar in her coffee as Malcolm sits in the seat across from her. Anna quietly takes a sip from her coffee. She glances across the table, then looks downward. Malcolm illustrates by lifting up his arm to shield his face. Malcolm halts walking. The words strike him hard. He gazes at Cole. Cole is astonished. Cole is playing behind the sofa. All we see is the top of his head. Occasionally we get glimpses of items Cole is playing with peeking over the back of the sofa, but we can't quite discern what he's doing. The top of Cole's head ceases moving. Cole has become very still. He glances directly at Malcolm. Malcolm observes him attentively. He rises and grabs his coat. Cole's brow furrows as he ponders it carefully. Malcolm turns back to Cole. Cole's sorrowful eyes gaze up at Malcolm. The surface of Malcolm's desk is covered with open volumes. Malcolm pours over a thick reference book. He encircles a phrase. His face turns up to the ceiling. Malcolm stands up and moves closer to their voices as he stretches his legs. Malcolm grins at Anna. Malcolm gradually stops grinning. Malcolm shakes his head in incredulity. Mr. Cunningham turns and gazes at his class of eight and nine-year-old private school students. He's just about to answer his own inquiry when he sees a hand rise. Mr. Cunningham looks astonished to see who it is.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: He gestures to the chair across the coffee table and shuts his eyes tightly. Surprised, Cole steps forward. Malcolm opens his eyes, looking directly at Cole. Cole takes another step, nearly reaching the chair. Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple and smiles, glancing at Cole’s arm. Cole wears a large silver watch that dangles on his thin wrist. Malcolm shuts his eyes again as Cole steps back. Surprised, Malcolm lowers his hands and touches his temple, gazing at Cole’s school uniform. Cole slowly retreats, answering with a small step back. Malcolm looks down at Cole’s feet. Cole stands still. Malcolm pauses, staring before speaking. Cole quietly steps back into the next room. His tiny figure disappears. Malcolm quickly enters a spacious, dim Italian restaurant and finds Anna, sitting alone at a corner table. An untouched cake with a candle sits before her. As Malcolm sits, Anna stirs sugar into her coffee and quietly sips. She glances up, then down. Malcolm raises his arm to shield his face in demonstration, then stops. The words hit hard. He stares at Cole, who is behind the couch. Only the top of Cole’s head is visible, occasionally revealing what he's playing with, though it's unclear. Cole freezes, looking at Malcolm, who watches closely. Malcolm stands and grabs his coat. Cole’s brow furrows in thought. Malcolm turns back as Cole’s sad eyes meet his. Malcolm’s desk is cluttered with open books. He pores over a thick reference, circles a phrase, and looks up at the ceiling. He gets up, stretches, and approaches the voices. Malcolm smiles at Anna, then slowly stops, shaking his head in disbelief. Mr. Cunningham turns to face his class of eight- and nine-year-olds. Cole rests his chin on his desk, watching wide-eyed. Cunningham scans the blank faces, about to answer his own question when a hand goes up. He’s surprised by who raised it.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Malcolm gestures to the chair. He closes his eyes. Cole steps forward, surprised. Malcolm opens his eyes, looking at Cole. Cole steps closer, reaching the chair. Malcolm smiles, lowering his fingers. He notices Cole's large silver watch. Malcolm closes his eyes. Cole steps back. Malcolm, surprised, lowers his hands. Malcolm observes Cole's uniform. Cole slowly steps back. Cole answers by stepping back. Malcolm looks at Cole's feet. Cole remains still. Malcolm waits before speaking, staring. Cole quietly retreats to another room's doorway. Malcolm enters a dimly-lit restaurant, finding Anna alone with a cake. Anna sips her coffee, glancing down. Malcolm shields his face with his arm. He stops, words hitting him hard. Cole, behind the couch, is still. Malcolm watches him, grabbing his coat. Cole's brow furrows. Malcolm turns to Cole's sad eyes. Malcolm's desk is cluttered with texts. He circles a phrase and looks up. Malcolm moves closer to voices, smiling at Anna. He stops smiling, shaking his head. Mr. Cunningham stares at his students. Cole watches with big eyes. Cunningham is surprised by a raised hand.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
He gestures towards the chair situated on the opposite side of the coffee table, indicating where he wants the other person to sit. He then closes his eyes tightly, as if deep in thought or concentration. Cole, feeling a bit taken aback by this unexpected gesture, cautiously takes a small step forward. With a sense of curiosity, Cole advances another step. At this moment, Malcolm opens his eyes and directs his gaze straight at Cole, making direct eye contact. Cole, feeling encouraged, takes yet another step forward. The next step he takes will bring him right up to the chair. Malcolm, in response, lowers his fingers from his temple, and a gentle smile spreads across his face. His eyes shift to Cole's arm, noticing that Cole is wearing a large silver watch, which appears oversized and loose on his slender wrist. Malcolm closes his eyes once more, perhaps contemplating something. In response, Cole takes a step back, retreating slightly. Malcolm, surprised by this action, lowers his hands and places his fingers back to his temple, as if trying to understand Cole's reaction. He then gazes at Cole's school uniform, taking in the details. Cole, moving slowly, takes another step back, signaling his response by retreating further. Malcolm's eyes drift down to Cole's feet, observing how still he has become. Malcolm takes his time before speaking, choosing instead to simply stare. Cole, in a quiet manner, steps back into the doorway of the adjacent room, his small figure retreating. 

Meanwhile, Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian restaurant, his eyes scanning the room until he finds Anna. She is seated alone at a corner table, where a small piece of cake with a candle in it remains untouched. Anna stirs sugar into her coffee as Malcolm takes a seat across from her. She quietly sips her coffee, her eyes briefly meeting his before she looks down. Malcolm demonstrates something by raising his arm to shield his face, then abruptly stops walking as if struck by a sudden realization. The words seem to hit him hard, and he stares intently at Cole, who is visibly surprised. Cole is playing behind the couch, and all that is visible is the top of his head. Occasionally, glimpses of the objects Cole is playing with peek over the back of the couch, but it is difficult to discern exactly what he is doing. Suddenly, the top of Cole's head stops moving, and he becomes very still, looking directly at Malcolm. Malcolm watches him with careful attention. He stands up and grabs his coat, preparing to leave. Cole's brow furrows as he ponders something deeply. Malcolm turns back to look at Cole, whose sad eyes gaze up at him. 

The surface of Malcolm's desk is cluttered with open texts, and he is deeply engrossed in a thick reference book. He circles a particular phrase, then lifts his face towards the ceiling, lost in thought. Malcolm rises from his seat and moves closer to where voices can be heard, stretching his legs as he does so. He smiles at Anna, but then his smile slowly fades. Malcolm shakes his head in disbelief, as if processing something unexpected. Mr. Cunningham turns to face his class of eight and nine-year-old private school students. Cole rests his chin on his desk, watching the class with wide, attentive eyes. Stanley Cunningham surveys the class of blank faces, just about to answer his own question when he notices a hand raised in the air. Mr. Cunningham is surprised to see who it is, as it was unexpected.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
He makes a gesture toward the chair positioned on the opposite side of the coffee table, clearly indicating where he would like the other person to take a seat. After doing so, he closes his eyes tightly, as though he is deep in contemplation or concentration. Cole, feeling slightly taken aback by this unexpected gesture, cautiously takes a small, hesitant step forward. With an increasing sense of curiosity piquing his interest, Cole bravely advances another step. At this precise moment, Malcolm opens his eyes and directs his gaze straight at Cole, making direct and unwavering eye contact. Encouraged by Malcolm's focused gaze, Cole takes yet another brave step forward. The next step he takes will bring him directly up to the chair. In response, Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple, and a gentle smile begins to spread softly across his face. His eyes shift downward to Cole's arm, noticing that Cole is wearing a large silver watch. This watch appears oversized and quite loose on his slender wrist. Malcolm then closes his eyes once more, possibly contemplating something. As a reaction to this, Cole takes a step back, retreating slightly. Malcolm, surprised by Cole's retreat, lowers his hands and places his fingers back to his temple as if trying to comprehend Cole's unexpected reaction. He then fixes his gaze on Cole's school uniform, taking note of all its details. Cole, moving slowly, takes another cautious step back, signaling his response by retreating further. Malcolm's eyes drift down to Cole's feet, observing how completely still he has become. Rather than speaking immediately, Malcolm takes his time, choosing instead to simply stare intently. In a quiet manner, Cole steps back into the doorway of the adjacent room, his small figure slowly retreating.

Meanwhile, Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian restaurant. His eyes scan the room until they find Anna seated alone at a corner table, where a small piece of cake with an unlit candle remains untouched. Anna calmly stirs sugar into her coffee as Malcolm takes a seat across from her. She quietly sips her coffee, her eyes meeting his briefly before she looks down. Malcolm demonstrates something by raising his arm to shield his face. Then, he abruptly stops walking, as if suddenly struck by a realization. The words seem to hit him hard, and he stares intently at Cole, who is visibly surprised. Cole is playing behind the couch, and only the top of his head is visible. Occasionally, glimpses of the various objects Cole is playing with peek over the back of the couch, but it is difficult to precisely discern what he is doing. Suddenly, the top of Cole's head stops moving, and he becomes very still, looking directly at Malcolm. Malcolm watches him closely with careful attention. He stands up, gathers his coat, and prepares to leave. Cole's brow furrows deeply, as he ponders something profoundly. Malcolm turns back to look at Cole, whose sad eyes gaze up at him with a sense of longing.

The surface of Malcolm's desk is cluttered with numerous open texts, and he is deeply engrossed in a thick reference book. He circles a particular phrase with interest, then lifts his face towards the ceiling, becoming lost in thought. Rising from his seat, Malcolm moves closer to where the sound of voices can be heard, stretching his legs as he does so. He offers a smile to Anna, but then his smile slowly fades away. Malcolm shakes his head in disbelief, as if he is processing something unexpected and hard to comprehend. Mr. Cunningham turns to face his class of eight and nine-year-old private school students. Cole rests his chin on his desk, watching the class with wide, attentive eyes. Stanley Cunningham surveys the class of blank faces, just about to answer his own question when he notices a hand raised in the air. Mr. Cunningham is genuinely surprised to see whose hand it is, as it was entirely unexpected.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Malcolm gestures towards the chair on the opposite side of the coffee table, indicating where he wants Cole to sit. He then closes his eyes tightly, as if trying to focus or gather his thoughts. Cole, taken aback by this unexpected gesture, hesitantly takes a small step forward, inching closer to the chair. As Cole takes another step, Malcolm opens his eyes and directs his gaze straight at Cole, acknowledging his presence. Cole continues to move forward, taking yet another step that will bring him right up to the chair. Observing this, Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple and offers a gentle smile, a gesture meant to reassure Cole. Malcolm's attention shifts to Cole's arm, noticing the large silver watch that seems oversized for Cole's thin wrist, almost as if it is swimming around it. With a contemplative expression, Malcolm closes his eyes once more. In response, Cole takes a step back, causing Malcolm to lower his hands in surprise. Malcolm then places his fingers back to his temple, his eyes scanning Cole's school uniform. Cole, feeling the weight of the moment, takes a slow, deliberate step backward. He continues to retreat, answering Malcolm's silent inquiry with another small step back. Malcolm's eyes follow Cole's movement, eventually settling on Cole's feet, which have become very still. Malcolm takes a moment, allowing silence to fill the space as he stares intently, contemplating his next words. Meanwhile, Cole quietly retreats further, stepping back into the doorway of the adjacent room, his small figure gradually disappearing from view. In a different setting, Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian restaurant, his eyes searching until they find Anna, who sits alone at a corner table. In front of her is a small piece of cake with a candle, untouched, as she stirs sugar into her coffee. Malcolm takes a seat across from her, and Anna quietly sips her coffee, her eyes briefly meeting his before she looks down. To demonstrate something, Malcolm raises his arm to shield his face, then abruptly stops walking as if struck by a sudden realization. The impact of the words he hears hits him hard, and he stares at Cole, who is now surprised. Cole is playing behind the couch, only the top of his head visible, with occasional glimpses of the toys he is playing with peeking over the back, though it's unclear what exactly he's doing. Suddenly, the movement of Cole's head ceases, and he becomes very still, locking eyes with Malcolm, who watches him with careful attention. Rising from his seat, Malcolm grabs his coat, while Cole's brow furrows in deep thought. Malcolm turns back to face Cole, meeting the boy's sad eyes that gaze up at him. Meanwhile, the surface of Malcolm's desk is cluttered with open texts, and he is deeply engrossed in a thick reference book, circling a particular phrase. His eyes drift upwards to the ceiling as he contemplates the information. Stretching his legs, Malcolm gets up and moves closer to where voices can be heard, smiling at Anna before his expression slowly fades. He shakes his head in disbelief, processing the situation. In a classroom setting, Mr. Cunningham turns to face his class of eight and nine-year-old private school students. Cole, resting his chin on his desk, watches the class with wide eyes. Stanley Cunningham surveys the room filled with blank faces, just about to answer his own question when he notices a hand raised in the air. Mr. Cunningham is taken aback, surprised to see who it is.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Malcolm gestures to the chair across the coffee table and closes his eyes tightly. Cole, surprised, steps forward cautiously. As Malcolm opens his eyes and looks at Cole, Cole continues to approach until he is near the chair. Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple, smiles, and notices Cole's oversized silver watch on his thin wrist. After closing his eyes again, Malcolm is surprised when Cole steps back, prompting Malcolm to lower his hands and observe Cole's school uniform. Cole retreats slowly, and Malcolm takes his time before speaking, simply watching as Cole steps back into the doorway of another room.

Malcolm then enters a dimly-lit Italian restaurant and finds Anna sitting alone at a corner table with an untouched piece of cake. As Malcolm sits across from her, Anna stirs sugar into her coffee, takes a sip, and glances across the table before looking down. Malcolm demonstrates shielding his face with his arm, then stops abruptly as the words impact him, staring at Cole, who is surprised and playing behind the couch. Occasionally, glimpses of Cole's toys peek over the couch, but his movements cease as he looks directly at Malcolm, who watches him intently. Malcolm rises, grabs his coat, and turns back to Cole, whose sad eyes meet his gaze.

Malcolm's desk is cluttered with open texts as he pores over a thick reference book, circling a phrase before looking up at the ceiling. He gets up, stretches his legs, and moves closer to the voices, smiling at Anna before his smile fades and he shakes his head in disbelief. Meanwhile, Mr. Cunningham addresses his class of young private school students, with Cole resting his chin on his desk, watching with wide eyes. As Mr. Cunningham surveys the blank faces, he is surprised to see a hand raised, ready to answer his question.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He points to the chair on the other side of the coffee table, a sturdy piece of furniture crafted by a renowned local artisan. He closes his eyes tight. Cole, surprised, takes a small step forward. Cole takes a step. Malcolm opens his eyes with the intensity of someone searching for answers. He looks right at Cole. Cole takes another step. The next step will put him at the chair, which is covered in a richly woven fabric from the historic mills of the region. Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple, a gesture reminiscent of a well-practiced meditation technique. Malcolm smiles, a warm expression often noted by his colleagues as his most disarming trait. Malcolm looks to Cole's arm. Cole is wearing a large silver watch from his grandfather, a keepsake of a bygone era, and it swims on his thin wrist. Malcolm closes his eyes, deep in thought. Cole takes a step back. Malcolm lowers his hands, surprised by the sudden retreat. Malcolm puts his fingers to his temple, a habit he developed during his years of intense study. He gazes at Cole's school uniform, which bears the emblem of an esteemed private institution known for its rigorous academics. Cole takes a slow step back. Cole answers by taking a small step back. Malcolm looks down at Cole's feet, encased in polished shoes that reflect his school’s strict dress code. Cole is very still. Malcolm takes his time before speaking. He just stares with the patience of someone accustomed to quiet observation. Cole quietly takes a step back into the doorway of the other room. Cole's tiny figure steps away. Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious, dimly-lit Italian restaurant that boasts a menu inspired by traditional Tuscan recipes. He finds Anna. Anna sits alone at a corner table. A small piece of cake with a candle in it sits untouched, a solemn reminder of her birthday. Anna stirs sugar in her coffee, a blend sourced from a small cooperative in Colombia, as Malcolm sits in the seat across from her. Anna quietly takes a sip from her coffee. She glances across the table, then looks down, hiding her feelings in a moment of introspection. Malcolm demonstrates by holding up his arm to shield his face, echoing a defensive stance he once saw in a classic film. Malcolm stops walking, absorbing the moment. The words hit him hard. He stares at Cole. Cole is surprised. Cole is playing behind the couch, his favorite spot since it feels like a hidden fortress. All we see is the top of his head. Every now and then we get glimpses of things Cole is playing with peeking over the back of the couch, but we can't quite make out what he's doing with his eclectic collection of toys. The top of Cole's head stops moving. Cole has become very still. He looks right at Malcolm. Malcolm watches him carefully. He rises and grabs his coat, an overcoat made of fine wool that was a gift from a dear friend. Cole's brow furrows as he thinks about it carefully, contemplating the weight of his choices. Malcolm turns back to Cole. Cole's sad eyes stare up at Malcolm, filled with the innocence and curiosity of youth. The surface of Malcolm's desk is covered with open texts, a testament to his lifelong passion for learning. Malcolm pours over a thick reference book, a volume on human psychology, critical to his profession. He circles a phrase, finding relevance in its insights. His face turns up to the ceiling, as if seeking guidance from above. Malcolm gets up and moves closer to their voices as he stretches his legs, a necessary pause after hours of sitting. Malcolm smiles at Anna, his expression softening in her presence. Malcolm slowly stops smiling as a realization dawns on him. Malcolm shakes his head in disbelief, grappling with unexpected news. Mr. Cunningham turns and stares at his class of eight and nine-year-old private school students, who are known for their inquisitive natures. Cole rests his chin on his desk and watches the class with big eyes, his mind racing with questions. Stanley Cunningham looks over the class of blank faces, each child a potential thinker waiting to emerge. He's just about to answer his own question when he sees a hand go up. Mr. Cunningham looks surprised to see who it is, as Cole rarely participates in class discussions unprompted.

The surface of Malcolm's desk is covered with open texts. Malcolm pours over a thick reference book. He circles a phrase. His face turns up to the ceiling. Malcolm gets up and moves closer to their voices as he stretches his legs. Malcolm smiles at Anna. Malcolm slowly stops smiling. Malcolm shakes his head in disbelief. Mr Cunningham turns and stares at his class of eight and nine year old private school students. Cole rests his chin on his desk and watches the class with big eyes. Stanley Cunningham looks over the class of blank faces. He is just about to answer his own question when he sees a hand go up. Mr Cunningham looks surprised to see who it is.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: He points to the chair on the other side of the coffee table. He closes his eyes tight. Cole surprised takes a small step forward. Cole takes a step. Malcolm opens his eyes. He looks right at Cole. Cole takes another step. The next step will put him at the chair. Malcolm lowers his fingers from his temple. Malcolm smiles. Malcolm looks to Cole's arm. Cole is wearing a large silver watch. It swims on his thin wrist. Malcolm closes his eyes. Cole takes a step back. Malcolm lowers his hands surprised. Malcolm puts his fingers to his temple. He gazes at Cole's school uniform. Cole takes a slow step back. Cole answers by taking a small step back. Malcolm looks down at Cole's feet. Cole is very still. Malcolm takes his time before speaking. He just stares. Cole quietly takes a step back into the doorway of the other room. Cole's tiny figure steps away. Malcolm hurriedly enters a spacious dimlylit Italian restaurant. He finds Anna. Anna sits alone at a corner table. A small piece of cake with a candle in it sits untouched. Anna stirs sugar in her coffee as Malcolm sits in the seat across from her. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Anna quietly takes a sip from her coffee. She glances across the table then looks down. Malcolm demonstrates by holding up his arm to shield his face. Malcolm stops walking. The words hit him hard. He stares at Cole. Cole is surprised. Cole is playing behind the couch. All we see is the top of his head. Every now and then we get glimpses of things. Cole is playing with peeking over the back of the couch but we cannot quite make out what he is doing. The top of Cole's head stops moving. Cole has become very still. He looks right at Malcolm. Malcolm watches him carefully. He rises and grabs his coat. Cole's brow furrows as he thinks about it carefully. Malcolm turns back to Cole. Cole's sad eyes stare up at Malcolm. Malcolm gets up and moves closer to their voices as he stretches his legs. Malcolm smiles at Anna. Malcolm slowly stops smiling. Malcolm shakes his head in disbelief. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She dances to the couch on the far side of the kitchen island. She opens her ears wide. Jamie, startled, leaps a giant hop backward. Jamie leaps a hop. Taylor shuts her ears. She gazes left at Jamie. Jamie leaps another hop. The following hop will land her at the couch. Taylor lifts her toes from her knee. Taylor frowns. Taylor gazes at Jamie's hat. Jamie is wearing a tiny red scarf. It climbs on her broad neck. Taylor shuts her ears. Jamie leaps a hop forward. Taylor lifts her knees amazed. Taylor places her toes on her knee. She squints at Jamie's raincoat. Jamie advances slowly forward. Jamie responds by leaping a tiny hop forward. Taylor gazes up at Jamie's fingers. Jamie is extremely fluid. Taylor speeds up before singing. She simply blinks. Jamie slowly leaps a tiny hop forward into the backyard of the other space. Jamie's huge shadow hops ahead. Taylor sluggishly exits a cramped, brightly-lit French diner. She loses Alex. Alex stands crowded at a side booth. A tall glass of juice with a flower in it stands moved. Alex shakes pepper in her tea as Taylor stands in the spot by her feet. Alex loudly takes a gulp from her tea. She peers under the booth, then gazes up. Taylor whispers by lifting down her legs to show her feet. Taylor keeps laughing. The sounds miss her lightly. She blinks at Jamie. Jamie is amazed. Jamie is swimming below the table. All you notice are the tips of her fingers. Occasionally, you spot hints of objects Jamie is swimming with sneaking under the top of the table, but you can't quite figure out what she's swimming. The bottom of Jamie's fingers begin moving. Jamie has grown extremely fluid. She gazes left at Taylor. Taylor ignores her absently. She sits and drops her shoes. Jamie's lips curl as she talks about her absently. Taylor forgets left about Jamie. Jamie's joyful hands wave down at Taylor. The ceiling of Taylor's shelf is emptied with closed pictures. Taylor stares over a light newspaper article. She squares a question. Her feet turn down to the floor. Taylor sits down and wanders farther from their music as she flexes her arms. Taylor frowns at Alex. Taylor quickly starts frowning. Taylor nods her toes in agreement. Ms. Lee faces and blinks at her staff of seven and ten-year-old public gymnastic athletes. Jamie lifts her foot on her shelf and ignores the staff with tiny hands. George Lee gazes under the staff of open faces. She's nowhere near to ask her own answer when she spots a foot go down. Ms. Lee gazes amazed to spot who it was.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Malcolm invites Cole to sit on the other side of the coffee table, closing his eyes momentarily. Cole hesitates but eventually steps forward, wearing a large silver watch. Malcolm observes Cole's school uniform as Cole steps back, surprised by Malcolm’s gaze. In a dimly-lit Italian restaurant, Malcolm joins Anna at a corner table where a cake with a candle sits. As they sit in silence, with Anna stirring her coffee, Malcolm shields his face and stops, impacted by words that seem to affect him deeply. Cole, playing behind a couch, becomes still and makes eye contact with Malcolm, who watches him intently. Malcolm, engrossed in his work with books spread over his desk, interacts with Cole again, noting Cole's thoughtful and sad expressions. In a classroom setting, Mr. Cunningham is surprised when Cole raises his hand, standing out among his classmates.
